Presentation 
• Breast cancers in pregnancy usually present as larger tumors.
• Unlike in the non- pregnancy state, a palpable lump, swelling, and discharging nipples may all be confused with
changes in pregnancy and not suspected to be from malignancy.
Diagnosis and Staging 
• When breast cancer is suspected, it is essential not to delay confirmation of the diagnosis through
